definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Among them was Zhang Ning, a female badminton player, who impressed me deeply.
sentences.chinese: 但最打動我的是女子羽毛球運動員張寧。
連父親都深深地被打動。

sentences.english: How to impress the interviewer within 10 seconds?
sentences.chinese: 如何在10秒鐘內打動面試官？

sentences.english: A lift your veil, once touched many hearts.
sentences.chinese: 一首掀起你的蓋頭來，曾打動了多少美好的心靈。

sentences.english: Touched, was infiltrating mind days better life, is to awaken the zen sound.
sentences.chinese: 打動，是浸潤心靈的天簌，是喚醒生命的禪音。

sentences.english: Obviously , he was moved by her entreaties.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，他被她的懇求打動了。

sentences.english: Few men have had such transcendental capacity to stir the heart of people.
sentences.chinese: 很少人有如此超羣出衆的打動人心的才能。

sentences.english: ShenXiaoLi for the birthday of the LABS for breakfast, make very affected.
sentences.chinese: 申孝利爲了拉拉的華誕準備了早餐，令拉拉非常打動。

sentences.english: The whole crowd were quite carried away by the young singer'sperformance.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年歌手的演唱深深地打動了所有的聽衆。

sentences.english: She was moved [touched] by these words.
Next week, I get a chauffeur-driven car to impress the clients.
sentences.chinese: 下週，我會有專職司機駕駛的汽車以打動客戶。

sentences.english: The students are moved by the old man's story.
sentences.chinese: 同學們爲那位白叟的故事而打動。

sentences.english: They needed a place to stay, and they worked their way into our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他們需要一個遮風避雨的地方，同時打動了我們的心。

sentences.english: The prince was attracted by the girl's beauty, and ambitious to marry her.
sentences.chinese: 王子爲女孩的美貌打動了，渴望能娶到她。

sentences.english: In a bing home by herself, she try and home into interaction.
sentences.chinese: 曉陽打動於家成的癡情，嘗試和家成交往。

definition: to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to enlighten/to explain (a text etc)/to stimulate (a mental attitude)/enlightenment/revelation/motivation
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
